channel.title: Jagex continually adding crap into the game
channel.description:
http://services.runescape.com/m=rswiki/en/DevBlog:First_Old_School_RuneScape_Content_Poll Patch notes also fixed toy mouses which we [u]did not vote on[/u]
[b]Improved routefinding[/b] - In 2007, RuneScape's routefinding suffered from latency-related issues, leading to bugs such as running back and forth, dancing around big monsters indefinitely, getting "You can't reach that" when clicking on an NPC adjacent to you, etc. Rewriting the routefinding to resolve this would be a fairly big job for the engine team. [b]Themed world list[/b] - The world list in the applet and on the website would be updated to show themed worlds. We'd get this list from your thread on the forums. [b]Stop Agility bottlenecks[/b] - Update key Agility obstacles to remove bottlenecks where only one player could pass through at a time. This would potentially cause graphical issues with players overlapping during the animations, but it would make certain training courses less frustrating. [b]Mouse camera[/b] - Allow the camera to be rotated by holding down the mouse scrollwheel and dragging. [b]Login queues[/b] - When you are trying to log into a world that's full, you are placed in a queue.
Future content
Mod Nexus has had a good trawl through the archive, looking for content that we could offer to add to OldSchool RS. This is the archive of content that was half-written in August 2007. There were quite a lot of projects in development at the time, some nearly ready for release, others very rudimentary. If a project was graphically complete, we can potentially finish off its code, fix any major bugs that arose after its original launch, and get it added to OldSchool RS. With some additional work from our game engine team, we're pretty sure we could offer you the following content that was added to RuneScape after the archive point of OldSchool RS: • The God Wars Dungeon • The Varrock Achievement Diary • Land of the Goblins (the penultimate Zanik story) • Path of Glouphrie (including its Slayer creatures) • The ZMI Altar
I... Don't even know what to say. First, I don't want a login que because that was the point of having a full world.. It was full! Clicking repeatedly to get in was the old school feel of it. Improved pathfinding is nice. I don't want god wars, or anything listed above.

item.title: Jagex continually adding crap into the game
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:182, topic:509312”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=627559.msg4355595#msg4355595 date=1377488420]

You don’t need to be a dick about it. At least respect a person’s gender…

No need to be sensitive. I didn’t even bother to look at who posted the link and I don’t favor one gender over the other.
[/quote]I wasn’t trying to be sensitive :P, just your post was a little bit douchey. It’s not really favoring one gender over the other, it’s just you gotta be aware whose a male/female. Isn’t it kind of rude to tell a girl he’s a boy and vise versa? Just my thoughts anyways[/quote]

I still don’t know who we are talking about since I don’t check who posted what. Only place I care to look at the forum name of users is the RSC section. Hopefully you get my point on why I don’t give two cents.

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex continually adding crap into the game
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

Ambokile:

[quote]RuneScape is able to spawn scenery and NPCs (non-player characters) dynamically, so by doing this whenever someone approaches Port Sarim, we can have a new deposit box on the pier. RuneScape is also able to edit interfaces dynamically using client-side code, a bit like altering a webpage via Javascript, so by taking a blank parchment interface and laboriously constructing Perdu’s item menu on it, we can generate a rough-looking shop screen.

HARDCODING!!![/quote]Sounds like they hired some of the former MSCPians :o

Read full topic
